casebody.data:
Valentine Hammann, Respondent v. Richard Jordan, Appellant. Decided March 4, 1890. Appeal from a judgment entered in favor of plaintiff upon a verdict directed by the court. A. Britton Havens, for appellant. Jacob F. Miller, for respondent.

Before Truax and Dugro, JJ.

The question involved was whether the evidence did not call for a submission to the jury. The Court (Dugro J., writing, Truax, J,, concurring) held that it did and reversed the judgment.
